column4: How do I access a folder in Ubuntu from my VirtualBox OS Win XP?
I remember I did it once, and it was really simple. I just wish I remember how to. ^
rigved : In Guest choose the VM-menu 'devices'>'Shared Folders' and choose then map you made in ubuntu
I did that. But I guess I have to make something in VirtualBox to open that filder.
rigved Now in guest(XP), open 'networkneighbourghhood', that's : My Networklocations> FullNetwork> VirtualboxShardFolders, than open the \\ map you made in ubuntu
Did you install the 'VirtualBox Guest Additions' in your guest?  (See the VM-menu of your guest-machine)
I use Ubuntu. And Windows XP in VB.
OK, Step1, make a map in e.g. your homedir, called 'virtmap'.
In XP-guest, choose the VM-menu 'devices' > 'shared folders'
I also added the folder I would like to share in Ubuntu there.
Can you 'ping' you host from within guest-XP ? I think it's an network-setting in Vbox
